text: Hey <@U02613K0X>, any chance to apply the same filter/sort rules to eats and cocktails? The mobile designs are paginated.
are they not applied already?
also, eats on mobile aren’t paginated individually right? there’s just a separate page for each category?
Oh yes, that's right.
looks like cocktails weightings should be good to go
Ok
<@U02613K0X> Heads up on the mobile animation stuff. We need to figure out a way to scale down the animation when phones are on landscape mode. Otherwise things look very weird
A file was shared
checking contract for mention of landscape
agree though gaston
yes that slipped my mind
*OR* option #2 is to force portrait but I don't know if can do that on all devices. iOS for sure.
i like force portrait
I believe the original design and even contract might have said that we were oortrait only.
portrait
Oops, misspoke about forcing orientation.
Was a phonegap thing, not browser.
you cant force it, but you can hide all content when in landscape and display a "rotate your device" image
Ha, I like that.
we have built sites that do portrait only in the past - it's definitely the best solve.
Agreed,
so we have to add the iobridge icon at the bottom of the site.
gaston i'm going to forward you the message
let's chat after lunch
no beer animation on the archives
only ask because client is asking something that contradicts this
That was my understanding
mine as well, contract supports this.
thanks
Also, if you need more ammunition: Animations support the idea of beer levels. Archived beers don't have levels since they aren't being served.
Does that make sense?
yes! makes total sense. contract also calls out no animation on archive page. we should have no troubles. :grinning:
:thumbsup:
A file was shared
